QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Apolipoprotein B100
QAPair.Answer: Apolipoprotein B100 (apoB100) is a protein that plays a role in moving cholesterol around your body. It is a form of low density lipoprotein (LDL). Mutations (changes) in the gene that directs the body's production of apoB100 can cause a condition called familial hypercholesterolemia . This is a form of high blood cholesterol that is passed down in families (inherited). This article discusses the test used to measure the level of apoB100 in the blood.
